paragraph: CHAPTER 8. "YOU HAVE WOKEN ME TOO SOON."
tokens: have woken

paragraph: When Hester reached her bedroom after prayers on that second evening, she was dismayed to find that she no longer could consider the pretty little bedroom her own.  It had not only an occupant, but an occupant who had left untidy traces of her presence on the floor, for a stocking lay in one direction and a muddy boot sprawled in another.  The newcomer had herself got into bed, where she lay with a quantity of red hair tossed about on the pillow, and a heavy freckled face turned upward, with the eyes shut and the mouth slightly open.
tokens: reach bedroom prayer second evening dismay find consider little bedroom own occupant occupant leave untidy trace presence floor stock lay direction muddy boot sprawl newcomer get bed lay quantity red hair toss pillow heavy freckled face turn eye shut mouth open

paragraph: As Hester entered the room, from these parted lips came unmistakable and loud snores.  She stood still dismayed.
tokens: enter room part lip come unmistakable loud snore stand dismay

paragraph: "How terrible!" she said to herself--"oh, what a girl! and I cannot sleep in the room with any one who snores--I really cannot!"
tokens: terrible say girl sleep room one snore

paragraph: She stood perfectly still, with her hands clasped before her, and her eyes fixed with almost ludicrous dismay on this unexpected trial.  As she gazed, a fresh discovery caused her to utter an exclamation of horror aloud.
tokens: stand hand clasp eye fix ludicrous dismay unexpected trial gaze fresh discovery cause utter exclamation horror

paragraph: The newcomer had curled herself up comfortably in _her_ bed.  Suddenly, to her surprise, a voice said very quietly, without a flicker of expression coming over the calm face, or the eyes even making an effort to open--
tokens: newcomer curl bed surprise voice say flicker expression come calm face eye make effort open

paragraph: "Are you my new school-mate?"
tokens: new school mate

paragraph: "Yes," said Hester, "I am sorry to say I am."
tokens: say sorry say

paragraph: "Oh, don't be sorry, there's a good creature; there's nothing to be sorry about.  I'll stop snoring when I turn on my side--it's all right. I always snore for half an hour to rest my back, and the time is nearly up.  Don't trouble me to open my eyes, I am not the least curious to see you.  You have a cross voice, but you'll get used to me after a bit."
tokens: sorry be good creature be sorry stop snore turn side right snore hour rest back time trouble open eye least curious see have cross voice use bit

paragraph: "But you're in my bed," said Hester.  "Will you please to get into your own?"
tokens: bed say get own

paragraph: "Oh, no, don't ask me; I like your bed best.  I slept in it the whole of last term.  I changed the sheets myself, so it does not matter.  Do you mind putting my muddy boots outside the door, and folding up my stockings?  I forgot them, and I shall have a bad mark if Danesbury comes in.  Good-night--I'm turning on my side--I won't snore any more."
tokens: ask like bed good sleep whole last term change sheet matter mind put muddy boot door fold stocking forget have bad mark come good night turn side snore more

paragraph: The heavy face was now only seen in profile, and Hester, knowing that Miss Danesbury would soon appear to put out the candle, had to hurry into the other bed as fast as she could; something impelled her, however, to take up the muddy boots with two very gingerly fingers, and place them outside the door.
tokens: heavy face see profile know appear put candle have hurry other bed impell take muddy boot finger place door

paragraph: She slept better this second night, and was not quite so startled the next morning when the remorseless gong aroused her from slumber.  The maid-servant came in as usual to light the candles, and to place two cans of hot water by the two wash-handstands.
tokens: sleep good second night startle next morning remorseless gong arouse slumber maid servant come usual light candle place can hot water wash handstand

paragraph: "You are awake, miss?" she said to Hester.
tokens: awake miss say

paragraph: "Oh, yes," replied Hester almost cheerfully.
tokens: reply

paragraph: "Well, that's all right," said the servant.  "Now I must try and rouse Miss Drummond, and she always takes a deal of waking; and if you don't mind, miss, it will be an act of kindness to call out to her in the middle of your own dressing--that is, if I don't wake her effectual."
tokens: right say servant try rouse take deal wake mind miss act kindness call middle own dress wake effectual

paragraph: With these words, the housemaid approached the bed where the red-haired girl lay again on her back, and again snoring loudly.
tokens: word housemaid approach bed red haired girl lay back snore

paragraph: "Miss Drummond, wake, miss; it's half-past six.  Wake up, miss--I have brought your hot water."
tokens: wake miss half past wake miss bring hot water

paragraph: "Eh?--what?" said the voice in the bed sleepily; "don't bother me, Hannah--I--I've determined not to ride this morning; go away--" then more sleepily, and in a lower key, "Tell Percy he can't bring the dogs in here."
tokens: say voice bed bother determine ride morning go low key tell bring dog

paragraph: "I ain't neither your Hannah, nor your Percy, nor one of the dogs," replied the rather irate Alice--"There, get up, miss, do.  I never see such a young lady for sleeping, never."
tokens: dog reply irate get miss do see young lady sleeping

paragraph: "I won't be bothered," said the occupant of the bed, and now she turned deliberately on her side and snored more loudly than ever.
tokens: bother say occupant bed turn side snore

paragraph: "There's no help for it," said Alice: "I have to do it nearly every morning, so don't you be startled, miss.  Poor thing, she would never have a good conduct mark but for me.  Now then, here goes.  You needn't be frightened, miss--she don't mind it the least bit in the world."
tokens: be help say have do morning startle miss poor thing have good conduct mark go frighten miss mind least bit world

paragraph: Here Alice seized a rough Turkish towel, placed it under the sleepy head with its shock of red hair, and, dipping a sponge in a basin of icy cold water, dashed it on the white face.
tokens: seize rough turkish towel place sleepy head shock red hair dip sponge basin icy cold water dash white face

paragraph: This remedy proved effectual; two large pale blue eyes opened wide, a voice said in a tranquil and unmoved tone--
tokens: remedy prove effectual large pale blue eye open wide voice say tranquil unmoved tone

paragraph: "Oh, thank you, Alice.  So I'm back at this horrid, detestable school again?"
tokens: thank horrid detestable school

paragraph: "Get your feet well on the carpet, Miss Drummond, before you falls off again," said the servant.  "Now then, you'd better get dressed as fast as possible, miss--you have lost five minutes already."
tokens: get foot carpet fall say servant dress possible miss lose minute

paragraph: Hester, who had laughed immoderately during this little scene, was already up and going through the processes of her toilet.  Miss Drummond, seated on the edge of her bed, regarded her with sleepy eyes.
tokens: laugh little scene go process toilet seat edge bed regard sleepy eye

paragraph: "So you are my new room-mate?" she said--"What's your name?"
tokens: new room mate say name

paragraph: "Hester Thornton," replied Hetty with dignity.
tokens: reply dignity

paragraph: "Oh--I'm Susy Drummond--you may call me Susy if you like."
tokens: call like

paragraph: Hester made no response to this gracious invitation.
tokens: make response gracious invitation

paragraph: Miss Drummond sat motionless, gazing down at her toes.
tokens: sit motionless gaze toe

paragraph: "Had not you better get dressed?" said Hester after a long pause, for she really feared the young lady would fall asleep where she was sitting.

paragraph: Miss Drummond started.

paragraph: "Dressed!  So I will, dear creature.  Have the sweet goodness to hand me my clothes."

paragraph: "Where are they?" asked Hester rather crossly, for she did not care to act as lady's-maid.

paragraph: "They are over there, on a chair, in that lovely heap with a shawl flung over them.  There, toss them this way--I'll get into them somehow."

paragraph: Miss Drummond did manage to get into her garments; but her whole appearance was so heavy and untidy when she was dressed, that Hester by the very force of contrast felt obliged to take extra pains with her own toilet.
tokens: manage get garment whole appearance heavy untidy dress very force contrast feel oblige take extra pain own toilet

paragraph: "Now, that's a comfort," said Susan, "I'm in my clothes.  How bitter it is!  There's one comfort, the chapel will be warm.  I often catch forty winks in chapel--that is, if I'm lucky enough to get behind one of the tall girls, where Mrs Willis won't see me.  It does seem to me," continued Susan in a meditative tone, "the strangest thing why girls are not allowed sleep enough."
tokens: comfort say clothes bitter be comfort chapel warm catch wink chapel lucky get tall girl see seem continue meditative tone strangest thing girl allow sleep

paragraph: Hester was pinning a clean collar round her neck when Miss Drummond came up close, leaned over the dressing-table, and regarded her with languid curiosity.
tokens: pin clean collar neck come close learn dress table regard languid curiosity

paragraph: "A penny for your thoughts.  Miss Prunes and Prism."
tokens: penny thought

paragraph: "Why do you call me that?" said Hester angrily.
tokens: call say

paragraph: "Because you look like it, sweet.  Now, don't be cross, little pet--no one ever yet was cross with sleepy Susy Drummond.  Now, tell me, love, what had you for breakfast yesterday?"
tokens: look sweet cross little pet cross sleepy tell love breakfast yesterday

paragraph: "I'm sure I forget," said Hester.
tokens: sure forget say

paragraph: "You _forget_?--how extraordinary!  You're sure that it was not buttered scones?  We have them sometimes, and I tell you they are enough even to keep a girl awake.  Well, at least you can let me know if the eggs were very stale, and the coffee very weak, and whether the butter was second-rate Dorset, or good and fresh.  Come now--my breakfast is of immense importance to me, I assure you."
tokens: _forget_ extraordinary sure butter scone have tell enough keep girl least let know egg stale coffee weak butter second rate good fresh come breakfast immense importance assure

paragraph: "I dare say," answered Hester.  "You can see for yourself this morning what is on the table--I can only inform you that it was good enough for me, and that I don't remember what it was."

paragraph: "Oh, dear!" exclaimed Susan Drummond, "I'm afraid she has a little temper of her own--poor little room-mate.  I wonder if chocolate-creams would sweeten that little temper?"

paragraph: "Please don't talk--I'm going to say my prayers," said Hester.

paragraph: She did kneel down, and made a slight effort to ask God to help her through the day's work and the day's play.  In consequence, she rose from her knees with a feeling of strength and sweetness which even the feeblest prayer when uttered in earnest can always give.

paragraph: The prayer-gong now sounded, and all the girls assembled in the chapel. Miss Drummond was greeted by many appreciative nods, and more than one pair of longing eyes gazed in the direction of her pockets, which stuck out in the most ungainly fashion.
tokens: prayer gong sound girl assemble chapel greet many appreciative nod more pair longing eye gaze direction pocket stick ungainly fashion

paragraph: Hester was relieved to find that her room-mate did not share her class in school, nor sit anywhere near her at table.
tokens: relieve find room mate share class school sit table

paragraph: When the half-hour's recreation after breakfast arrived, Hester, determined to be beholden to none of her school-mates for companionship, seated herself comfortably in an easy chair, with a new book.  Presently she was startled by a little stream of lollipops falling in a shower over her head, down her neck, and into her lap.  She started up with an expression of disgust.  Instantly Miss Drummond sank into the vacated chair.
tokens: half hour recreation breakfast arrive determined beholden school mate companionship seat easy chair new book startle little stream lollipop fall shower head neck lap start expression disgust sink vacate chair

paragraph: "Thank you, love," she said, in a cosy, purring voice.  "Eat your lollipops, and look at me; I'm going to sleep.  Please pull my toe when Danesbury comes in.  Oh, fie!  Prunes and Prisms--not so cross--eat your lollipops; they will sweeten the expression of that--little--face."
tokens: thank love say cosy purr voice eat lollipop look go sleep pull toe come prune prism cross eat lollipop sweet expression little face

paragraph: The last words came out drowsily.  As she said "face," Miss Drummond's languid eyes were closed--she was fast asleep.
tokens: last word come say face languid eye close fast asleep
